info.title: Financial Integration Service
info.description: Allows an external system to interact with financial documents generated from SAP Concur, for financial posting into an ERP.  Provides an automated solution to request available data objects such as approved expense reports, cash advances, and invoices to import to the client internal system, with an opportunity to send posting confirmation back into SAP Concur before the object is locked down and cannot be altered in SAP Concur.

externalDocs.description: Financial Integration Service v4 - Getting Started

tags.name: Financial Transactions
tags.description: Interacting with financial documents generated from Concur.

post.summary: Confirms results of financial transactions posting.
post.description: This API allows financial posting results to be sent to Concur.

post.summary: Confirms results of financial transactions payment posting.
post.description: This API allows financial posting results to be sent to Concur.

post.summary: Acknowledges successful retrieval of financial transaction(s).
post.description: This API allows a financial system to acknowledge/confirm that it has successfully retrieved one or more financial transactions and will begin to process those transactions. These transactions are then taken out of the ready queue.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of financial transactions.
get.description:
If docId is not present, the results are paged, page size is 100 by default if limit is not specified. Only one type of transaction can be retrieved at a time - specified by the docType.
If paging is occurring, each response contains a URI to retrieve the next page of transactions (if more exist).
If systemId is specified, the returned list of queued documents is filtered by systemId. Paging applies.
If docId is specified, a single document which matches docId is returned. Paging does not apply.
If docId and systemId are specified, a single document whose docId AND systemId match the values is returned. Paging does not apply.
If docId is specified and ignoreDocumentStatus is no, a document which has not been retrieved by an ERP system is returned only, i.e document status is READY. If ignoreDocumentStatus is yes, a document is returned regardless of status.

systemId.description: The ERP Id that acknowledged the document.
The ERP Id that acknowledged the document.

paymentRef.description: Any message corresponding to payment reference being processed.

systemId.description: The ERP Id that acknowledged the document.

ids.description: The list of document ID's that to be acknowledged.

items.description: The list of document ID's that to be acknowledged.

systemId.description: The ERP Id that acknowledged the document.

acknowledgeResult.description: Acknowledge processing result, succeeded or failed.

x-sap-shortText: Interact with financial documents from SAP Concur into an ERP.
